Sensitive setting protection by biometrics and the security delay

If an attempt is made to change any of these settings while your phone isn't in a safe place, you'll need to use biometric notification to verify that it's you. In addition, Identity Check adds extra security that makes it harder for someone to take over any Google Account signed in on this device.

For some sensitive settings, you will need to wait 1 hour before the setting can be changed. If your phone is turned off or restarted, the 1-hour delay will start again from the beginning. If your phone moves to a safe place, the 1-hour delay will end and you can change the setting immediately.

• Turn off Identity check
• Add, change, or delete safe places in Identity check
• Add, change, or delete biometrics
• Turn off Allow this phone to be found
To protect your privacy, safe places are only stored on your phone and aren't collected by Samsung. If you use Identity check on a different device, you'll need to set your safe places again.
To improve your location accuracy, it is recommended to turn on Wi-Fi scanning and Bluetooth scanning in Settings > Location > Location services.
